rComments: make sure you pay attention to listening examples. You should probably have a separate place to take notes on each example.
Lectures are very disorganized and hard to understand
Take this class if you want to ruin your GPA and have a horrible quarter.  Karlton hester is the worst professor at UCSC

Man if you are not interested in jazz don't take his class and don't write crappy reviews because all you wanted was an easy A.  If the opposite is true I think you will find his class and his book very insightful.  This guy really cares and isn't b.s'ing around. What more would you want

Oh god, stay away from this class. He says the book is mandatory and assigns impossible amounts of reading, then doesn't test on any of it. Lectures are fragmented and he's entirely full of himself. Tests on the most inane and minute details, and instead of giving us time to take a test he insists we all hear his sax playing.DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS

He changed the system so that you must buy the book and attend class, otherwise no one would do either. The quizzes ask for highly detailed information which is NOT in the lecture or the reading. Many students try to sleep until the quiz (one student even brought a pillow), but he blasts jazz to wake them up. PS: Stop deleting our comments Karlton!

Do NOT take this class. boring, tedious, and frustrating. dont be lured in by the three gen eds. Hester is an arrogant teacher who teaches in a "musical style" that most students find disorganized and difficult to learn from. Hester thinks too highly of himself. Your grade is based on 3 tests only, not worth the stress and frustration.
No Comments

I purchased his book from a student who had him in the past, but it turns out he released a new version of the book (Second edition). He told the class, "You might be able to pass if you have the old book, but a lot of it is different." I let that go; but to use the website he gave, you have to pay 10$! Outrageous! He rambles a lot. Avoid him!

Although Hester obviously knowns the source material the class is completely scattershot and unclear. He does not give a clear idea on what material to study, and most test questions come from the minute details that Karlton lightly skims over in class. Lectures are long and tedious. I would suggest not taking this class.

I hate Hester, he was never clear about anything, his powerpoints seemed prepared by someone else because he'd never read through them and they were never consistent looking. Grammatical errors on notes and tests, very unprofessional. He treats the class as if all are advanced music majors when a majority are taking it for a GE. He's the worst.

Worse professor I've had at UCSC, and I've been here 4 years.  Arrogant, unclear, no organization whatsoever, and the worst exam setup ever.  Spare yourself, and skip a class from this guy.  Material may sound interesting, but Hester IS AWFUL.

This class was horrible, I came into the class with a interest in the subject excited to learn, and was completly discouraged by the lack of clarity and organization. Also half of what he said was redundant and was a pointless rant about how white people have destroyed and degraded jazz music. He was egotistical and a horrible teacher.
Karlton is pompous and condescending to the point that it was a major distraction from course curriculum.

book is only good if you want to read a lot, and his lectures are boring. imppossible to know what to study, but memorize the practice tests and youll do fine. learn the songs he plays in class, those will be on listening tests. go to class, if only to sleep-sometimes you get extra credit. i took this as summer school, and it was okay.
if memorizing more than a hundred jazz songs that all sound the same seems like fun to you then you will have a jolly good time taking this class. Also its as much about racism as it is about Jazz.

lectures were longggg. he tried to make the class more interesting by having guest speakers and students perform live for extra credit. if you want an A in the class, i suggest going to lectures because sometimes he spits out things that are going to be on the midterm/final. STUDY THE PRACTICE TESTS! if you buy his book, skim it!
HARD AND BORING CLASS!!! DO NOT TAKE FOR GE, not worth it

karlton was a nice guy, but a horrible professor. to get an A all you have to do is 1)study the practice midterm and final and 2)study the songs for the listening exams. lecture was almost impossible to get through but this class was a pretty easy A and worth 3 GEs so it was worth taking
HARD CLASS. PROFESSOR IS NOT CLEAR, AND HE IS UNORGANIZED. NOT THE BEST LEARNING EXPERIENCE. MY ADVICE READ THE BOOK!!

Despite what most will say, Hester is a very patient man who knows his Jazz. He's a really nice guy and if you need help all you really have to do is ask. Sure things can be unclear and the material can get confusing, but there has to be compromise. :/

He focused more on telling you what's on the test rather than teaching the material. I didn't understand why he has to review what's on the midterm on the first week of class, blindly telling us the names that are on the test.
No Comments
DO NOT take history of jazz. It is a waste of time. he does not teach a thing. If you want to learn and get a good grade u must memorize the book and live on the CD-ROM. not UC material
DO NOT take History of Jazz from Karlton E. Hester!!!! Just don't.

Karlton E Hester is an interesting man.  He is not the best at explaining the material, and relies too much on his book.  He is knowledgable in music, and could be a better teacher if he had a smaller class

One of the most BORING and disorganized classes ive taken this year. Sure, its 3 GEs, but its so not worth this torture. He doesn't teach you anything. The only reason why I go to the class is to listen to jazz. And sometimes, its not even worth it to go.

Some people should not be teachers, period.  If you want to learn, you have come to the wrong class.  Started reviewing for the midterm during the first week before we learned anything.  Teaches by listing off names you would have no idea about.

Double pony tails?  This man is a bumbling idiot.  If you know anything, and i mean anything, about jazz this class will suck.  If you want to feel cultured by being able to drop some names while listening to jazz take this class.  But then you suck.

1st wk. of class--very unorganized! he spent it taking attendance & giving assigned seating for 400 ppl. after that it was confusing on what was going on because the first few wks. didn't correspond with the syllabus--ta's weren't helpful as well.

He does not teach anything in his unorganized lectures. His listening tests are fairly easy, but are completely useless. Do not take his class; the 3 GEs are not worth the suffering of a boring useless class. Waste of my time.
he's ****, he's extremely egotistical and he cannot teach. He used to teach at Columbia and i guess they didn't think much of him either or he wouldn't be here. if you want to learn DO NOT TAKE HIM.
Very talented. Fun classes.

i loved the class. made me expand my music selection. his tests were a piece of cake. 20 one paged journal entries due at the end of the quarter about either lecture or reading, mult choice tests, name that tune quizzes.  great
This man is really cool.  He writes really cool music too.  Take a class from this fellow.  He is one of the only not fogey old professors at UCSC.

His "listening quizes" are of the "name that tune" form, basically memorize the first 30 seconds of 20+ jazz songs.  How does this teach me anything?  Class had the potential to be the best I've ever taken, and it was poorly execut

Karlton expects a lot from his students, but if you really want to learn how to improv. then that is what you need. He put a lot of pressure on all his students to practice and learn and I know I did both, A LOT. He is a really likeable guy, EXTREMELY talented, and a very good teacher.

jumped through eras and name dropped and said a lot of completely useless things. wrote his own book so its all his opinions and a lot of the time its about the white man keeping people down, which happened but he seems to complain a lot about white people faking jazz. in fact the class was more about saying whats "jazz" not jazz. boring.
This guy is really good.  His talks on music are deep and inspire you to get into the music.
I agree that the class was probably way too hard and confusing for a GE class, but it does cover THREE GE credits so what do you expect.  I am a music major and I really liked the class.
History of jazz had a very easy first midterm...look at the cd rom added with the book...the second however was extremely hard and the final was really easy...class wasn't too bad

This class was awful.  He quoted himself, and would jump around eras, and spent more time complaining about white people than anything.  This was not a class of "Jazz," but rather a class of "Hesterian politics"
Lecture was very disorganized and confusing. The class itself felt like it was a waste of time.

My biggest problems were probably the length of the tests and the fact that I couldn't understand anything he said. I don't blame him for the tests because it was his first time using multiple choice, but it was very frustrating when he said something was important but no one heard what he said.

COMPLETE ****ING ****. avoid this class taught by hester at all costs. i barely passed i hope.  all u basically do in that class is listen to CDs and his first midterm is like decent but his 2nd one everyone fails. but his final is easy. but if u want the GEs good luck.
disorganized, uninteresting, confusing.  Reading the book is not necessary, the exams are confusing as is with just the lecture.
You just know a course is going to be****ty when the teacher quotes himself...in the book that he wrote.
this class was unreasonably difficult for a GE. he turned an interesting topic into something dreadful. interesting reading, but the tests had 176 questions each and very very hard

I find the material really interesting and LOVE the music.But he goes over things way too fast.  It sorta disorganized. It's hard to take the class and understand a lot if you don't have a background in music first.
Incredible teacher.  A lot of fun to watch.  I wish I could take his jazz class classes.  Oh, I mean what some call jazz.

This was one of the first three courses I took in college, and I credit it for my subsequent 2 years of mediocre grades(2.7 average from 3.8 in HS).  I really thought every other class was going to be this easy.  He makes you buy a huge book that he wrote in which he refuses to say the word "jazz".

History of Jazz had so much potential, to inspire an MTV crowd to love America's greatest art form in its glory. Hester acheived the opposite, with onerous lectures, excessive emphasis on obscure points, wildly varying exams, and awful disorganization.
disorganized and dissapointing.i signed up for this class very excited for the topic, and left feeling unchallenged and bored!easy A. GREAT musician
He is the most disorganized teacher I've ever had. Sitting through class was a nightmare. He had no personality, and he forced 450 students to assigned seats. He's not quite right in the head.
Super Easy. All my friends and I got an A+ from him. He gave huge extra credit on the tests. Super easy to cheat in that class. Take 80E if u need 3 GEs and want to bump ur GPA up.

Hands down the worst professor I have ever encountered, and I'm a MCD bio major, most of my professors as is only care about research.  He's a good Musician, but that doesn't make him a good teacher.  The class was horribly unorganized.

Karlton is obviously knowledgeable in Jazz but he's far from a good professor. Lectures are very scattered, and he doesn't give you a sense of direction on what you should be studying - he expects you to know everything. Grade was based on a midterm and a final, which were somewhat easy. Study the practice exams and take good notes to succeed.
Go to class, and pay attention to the videos and guest speakers. Your grade basically comes from the midterm and final. Read the book!

Hester is a great professor. He doesn't want his students to fail the class so he makes his tests super easy. It helps to have a musical background, or an appreciation for jazz. Don't listen to the slackers, criticizing the class. They clearly just don't get what the class is really about.

karlton was super kewl..im still takin the class but im confident my views wont change...yah it's an easy class if u study the online midterm and final, but you learn a LOT too..i can say that i truly appreciate some of the great jazz musicians after *attending* his lectures..honestly u shud go just to learn, it's pretty kewl stuff, karltons good!

After the midterm I learned one thing: I never have to go to class. the practice exam WAS the exam, and the only thing you need to know are the songs he'll use on the test- get them off online lecture notes. Don't even bother buying the book- I never even opened it and got an A. By the end of the class, though, I did learn a lot about jazz.

Hester is a horrible teacher. He clearly does not care about the class or the students in it. How to get an A: read the online exams, study hard right before exam. Prepare to be offended by his textbook, it will make you livid. If you want to learn about Jazz, don't take this class. If you just want to get some gen. eds, go ahead.

how to get an A in intro to jazz: 1)don't go to class if you don't want to 2)go to the website and study the "practice" midterm and final 3)study those really hard the week before each test 4)get the list of songs from someone else and listen in the library--that's it. he is obviously talented and smart, but a horrible teacher.

The beginning of class is slow, but it picks up.  Hesters a pretty cool dude and he knows what he's talking about.  Sometimes he's a little dry, but you can always leave if you have something better to do.  Just remember that he has a lot of knowledge and experience and you'll learn just from being around him.

I took this class in Fall 2005, which was for 3 GE's.  Don't fall into that trap.  Miss one lecture, the class is moot.  The midterms have been from the notes online, but that doesn't mean that things will be easy from jump.

Ya..basically, you learn 20 names (at least 3 of them don't have 1 vowel) for the same African instrument. No effort was put into the course. He puts half of the actual test online and the rest is literally straight from your notes. Hell, we even had to memeorize every country in Africa for a test. It's not sixth grade anymore...

Don't take this class. Don't look at these bad ratemyprofessor.com reviews and say "Oh, i'm sure it's not that bad" Lectures are long and boring. He knows everything there is to know about Jazz history, but after taking that class, I barely know anything new. If you do take it, the questions and answers to the tests are online. Make sure to find th
Extremely knowlegable, however not a very good lecturer. Unclear on what needs to be known.

very knowledgeable, and dealing with interesting material, but an awful lecturer. I like the guy, but sheeit- the class was just rote memorization of ridiculous arcane info. seems likme he would be spectacular in a more intimate setting
jus..wow its not what u expect..its hard

This is a guy who loves his jazz but cannot teach.  He'll go off on what you "need to know" but will rarely explain anything.  He bascially expects you to learn all the details in this fat-ass book he wrote himself.  I would have never passed, but the practiced tests are exactly the same as the real thing so it didn't matter...
A very strict teacher. He doesn't prepare his students well for his tests. Boring Lectures.

This was a worthless class. I wanted to learn about jazz, but instead I had to put up with Karlton's bs. His answer to any question was "It's in the book" (that he wrote and we had to buy to pass the class, nothing like making money off your students). Avoid this class, IT'S NOT WORTH IT!
Not very good at lecturing. Didn't address jazz evolution as a style, just a bunch of name dropping. Didn't prepare students well..
not a good professor
No Comments
